chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig D. Brue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh.-JOYRIDING, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. Probation in counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.
Concurrent with: Probation in counts 1&2 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. 
 Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.  
Defendant shall have a Psychological  Evaluation releasing all records to the agent upon request

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted credit for 26 days served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig D. Brue

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Victims wish to amend bond to delete the no contact-granted  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing. The defendant shall have no contact with D.B., L.B. or P.B. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
AMENDED 02/04/2016  The no contact with D.B., L.B., and P.B is lifted

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
